newsitem.title: LITHUANIA: FOREIGN INVESTMENT IN 1996 2.29 BLN LITAS.
newsitem.headline: FOREIGN INVESTMENT IN 1996 2.29 BLN LITAS.

text.p: Foreign direct investment in Lithuania in 1996 was 2.287 billion litas, the statistics department said on Thursday.

The top 1996 investors were from the U.S. at 663 million litas, Germany at 301 million litas, Sweden at 275 million litas, the U.K. at 178 million litas and Luxembourg at 110 million litas, the department said in a statement.
The figures for investment are cumulative since the early 1990s. It did not give a separate total for 1996.

The areas that have attracted most investment so far are in the food, products, drinks and tobacco sector at 394 million litas, communications at 224 million litas and financial intermediaries at 118 million litas.
